passages.text: Australia | Metals & Mining IGO Limited
Equity Research August 29, 2025

Kwinana continues to bleed with a resolution proving elusive. Greenbushes CGP3 production is critical for the investment thesis as Nova enters a volatile twilight year. IGO continues to right- size the business, however volatile cashflow out of TLEA remains a key concern. The lithium market is showing signs of improvement. Downgrade to UNDERPERFORM (from HOLD), AUD4.20.

Shrinking to greatness. While management are controlling the controllable within the business, with Nova end of life approaching and no material exploration success the number of value accretive controllables is ever decreasing. As such, the imperative to resolve the exposure to the under- delivering and cash consuming Kwinana is only growing. Without this resolution, we believe the strong cashflow from Greenbushes is disproportionately discounted by the market.

FY25 Results - Mostly in- line, impairment noise. Underlying EBITDA loss of \(\) 43\(m was mostly in - line with JEFE and VAE (Figure 2), Stat. EBITDA loss of\) \ \(709m\) included impairments of \(\) 605m\(for Kwinana,\) \ \(58m\) de- recognition of TLEA deferred tax assets, and a \(\) 115m\(impairment for exploration assets. D&A was\) \ \(28m\) higher than our forecast, and a lower share of equity accounted investments led to an in- line NPAT/EPS. Closing net cash of \(\) 280m\(was pre - released, with no TLEA dividends paid in the period. The revolving facility was right - sized and extended to\) \ \(300m\) maturing 31- Jul- 28, setting liquidity at \(\) 580m\(per any working capital movements. Windfield held US\) \ \(425m\) cash (from \(\) 424m\() & drawn debt of US\) \ \(1,350m\) (from \(\) 1,390m\$

Capital returns. The capital management framework targets 20- 40% of uFCF when liquidity is below A\ \(0.5bn, with higher returns considered above that threshold. FY25 underlying FCF was\) \ \(49m\) and there were no TLEA dividends received given the lower lithium price environment and ongoing investment cycles at Greenbushes and Kwinana.

FY26 guidance reiterated for Greenbushes at 1,500- 1,650kt @ \(\) 310- 360\(/t vs. JEFE: 1,593kt @\) \ \(398 / t\) | VAE: 1,582kt @ \(\) 349/t; and Nova at 15- 18kt Ni @ \(\) 5.9- 6.9/lb vs. JEFE: 15.9kt @ \(\) 6.1/lb\(/VAE: 12.9kt @\) \ \(5.1/lb\) with an end- of- life expected in the 20 FY26. Greenbushes camec is guided at \(\) 575- 624\(/t (JEFE:\) \ \(630m\) | VAE \(\) 638m\(. Kwinana production is guided at 9 - 11kt @\) \ \(16,000 - 20,000\) (JEFE: 18.4kt @ \(\) 18,425/t\$

Downgrade to UNDERPERFORM (from HOLD). AUD4.20. IGO continues to right- size the business, CGP3 production growth and recovery in the spodumene market are positive. Kwinagospend continues to dampen earnings potential, and lack of clarity around TLEA cash timing remains a concern.
Please see analyst certifications, important disclosure information, and information regarding the status of non-US analysts on pages 5 - 10 of this report. \\* Jefferies (Australia) Pty Ltd

IGO is positioned as a diversified miner/producer of a broad suite of critical clean energy materials. While we are attracted to IGO for its diverse suite of battery material assets, which sit low on the cost curve, uncertainty of the company's nickel division and challenges with inorganic growth opportunities in lithium underpin our Hold recommendation.
Risk/Reward - 12 Month View
Base Case, AUD4.2, - 18%

Our base- case PT is based on a blend of DCF, EV/EBITDA, and P/CF multiples and assumes IGO mines the remaining 6yrs of mine life at Nova and ramps up Greenbushes Lithium mine to match the Kwinana Lithium Hydroxide refinery demand.
Upside Scenario, AUD7, +37%
Our upside scenario PT is based on a blend of DCF, EV/EBITDA, and P/CF multiples and utilises our base- case assumptions but assumes a \(15\%\) higher commodity price deck.
Downside Scenario, AUD2.5, - 51%
Our downside scenario PT is based on a blend of DCF, EV/EBITDA, and P/CF multiples and utilises our base- case assumptions but assumes a \(15\%\) lower commodity price deck.

Top Material Issue(s): Sector issues include the consideration of traditional owners of the land on which mines are located, net- zero targets and actions being taken to achieve set goals, and workforce safety and structure, for example, local community hired vs Fly- in, Fly- out workers.

Company Target(s): 1) Aspires to be carbon- neutral across all operations and activities by 2035. 2) ESG measures are included in the compensation framework. Targets have been set with transparent performance hurdles for the following ESG criteria: health, safety, environment, and community; people; and culture. 3) Specific targets: Employee engagement survey overall score of at least \(72\%\) year- on- year improvement in percentage of women employed and workforce who are Aboriginal.

Questions to Management: 1) What component of your energy usage is derived from renewable energy sources? - - both fixed infrastructure (eg. mill) and mobile (eg. haul fleet)? 2) What are your scope one, two, and three emissions? 3) Who are the traditional owners of the land on which you operate? What are your interactions with them?
ESG Sector Deep Dive: Mining

Completion and commissioning of the Greenbushes TRP, CGP3, and CGP4 growth options. Clarity over LoM at Nova; Clarity over C&M costs for Cosmos & Forrestania; Improvements in Kwinana Train 1 throughput rates; Clarity on Train 1 profitability, and long- term viability; Updated strategy on inorganic M&A.

IGO LimitedIGO Limited is a mineral exploration company focusing on commodities critical to clean energy. Following the sale of its \(30\%\) stake in the Tropicana gold mine, the company's key mining operation is the Nova nickel mine in Western Australia. IGO has announced an acquisition for a \(24.99\%\) stake in the Greenbushes Lithium Mine and \(50\%\) stake in the Kwinana lithium hydroxide plant. It also engages in the exploration of nickel and copper projects located in Western Australia, Northern Territory, and South Australia, as well as Greenland. The company was formerly known as Independence Group NL and changed its name to IGO Limited in January 2020. IGO Limited was founded in 2000 and is headquartered in Perth, Australia.

Our PT is based on a blend of DCF, EV/EBITDA, and P/CF multiples. Risks: impact of Covid- 19; fluctuations in commodity prices and Australian dollar; estimates of mineral resources and ore reserves are subject to error; reserves depleted by production must be continually replaced; mining and insurance risks; environmental, health, safety, and permits; climate change; community relations.
(Article 3(1)e and Article 7 of MAR) Recommendation Published Recommendation Distributed

Buy - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of \(15\%\) or more within a 12- month period. Hold - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of plus \(15\%\) or minus \(10\%\) within a 12- month period.

Underperform - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of minus \(10\%\) or less within a 12- month period. The expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) for Buy rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10 is 20\%\) or more within a 12- month period as these companies are typically more volatile than the overall stock market. For Hold rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10, the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is plus or minus 20\%\) within a 12- month period. For Underperform rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10, the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is minus 20\%\) or less within a 12- month period.
NR - The investment rating and price target have been temporarily suspended. Such suspensions are in compliance with applicable regulations and/or Jefferies policies.
CS - Coverage Suspended. Jefferies has suspended coverage of this company.
NC - Not covered. Jefferies does not cover this company.

Restricted - Describes issuers where, in conjunction with Jefferies engagement in certain transactions, company policy or applicable securities regulations prohibit certain types of communications, including investment recommendations.
Monitor - Describes securities whose company fundamentals and financials are being monitored, and for which no financial projections or opinions on the investment merits of the company are provided.

Jefferies methodology for assigning ratings may include the following: market capitalization, maturity, growth/value, volatility and expected total return over the next 12 months. The price targets are based on several methodologies, which may include, but are not restricted to, analyses of market risk, growth rate, revenue stream, discounted cash flow (DCF), EBITDA, EPS, cash flow (CF), free cash flow (FCF), EV/EBITDA, P/E, PE/growth, P/CF, P/FCF, premium (discount)/average group EV/EBITDA, premium (discount)/average group P/E, sum of the parts, net asset value, dividend returns, and return on equity (ROE) over the next 12 months.

Jefferies Franchise Picks include stock selections from among the best stock ideas from our equity analysts over a 12 month period. Stock selection is based on fundamental analysis and may take into account other factors such as analyst conviction, differentiated analysis, a favorable risk/reward ratio and investment themes that Jefferies analysts are recommending. Jefferies Franchise Picks will include only Buy rated stocks and the number can vary depending on analyst recommendations for inclusion. Stocks will be added as new opportunities arise and removed when the reason for inclusion changes, the stock has met its desired return, if it is no longer rated Buy and/or if it triggers a stop loss. Stocks having 120 day volatility in the bottom quartile of S&P stocks will continue to have a 15% stop loss, and the remainder will have a 20% stop. Franchise Picks are not intended to represent a recommended portfolio of stocks and is not sector based, but we may note where we believe a Pick falls within an investment style such as growth or value.

Notes: Each box in the Rating and Price Target History chart above represents actions over the past three years in which an analyst initiated on a company, made a change to a rating or price target of a company or discontinued coverage of a company. Legend:

I: Initiating Coverage 
D: Dropped Coverage 
B: Buy 
H: Hold 
UP: Underperform
